Health care–acquired infections are a significant cause of morbidity and mortality, costing billions of dollars annually. The most common health care–associated infections include urinary tract infections, surgical site infections, pneumonia, and bloodstream infections. The following table describes the most common healthcare-acquired pathogens, according to the CDC.[
